conclusion: The image shows a setup with liquid sources labeled A, B, and C at the top, colored baffle obstacles in the middle, and collection containers labeled D, E, F, and G at the bottom.
The task is to track the path of liquid from each source through the baffles to determine which container it will end up in.
Source A is positioned slightly left of center at the top.
Liquid from A would encounter obstacles in its path as it flows down.
The white, black, and blue baffles would likely deflect the liquid rightward.
Following the path through these deflections, the liquid would most likely end up around the center-right area.
The center-right position aligns with container F at the bottom.
Source B is positioned to the right of center at the top.
Liquid from B would flow downward and encounter the yellow baffle, which would deflect it leftward.
The blue baffle would further deflect its path.
Following these deflections, the liquid would likely flow toward the center area.
The center position aligns with container E at the bottom.
Source C is positioned at the far right at the top.
Liquid from C would encounter the yellow baffle, which would deflect it leftward.
The orange baffle would likely cause another deflection.
Following these multiple deflections, the liquid would most likely end up around the far left area.
The far left position aligns with container D at the bottom.
Liquid from source A will flow into container F.
Liquid from source B will flow into container E.
Liquid from source C will flow into container D.
